name: Omni Parker House

reviews.text: Because of business I stayed at the Parker House for the first time last week. The location is excellent- walking distance to the theater district, restaurants of the North End, the Financial District, Charles Street, Beacon Hill and the Flat of the Hill and Newberry Street.
reviews.title: Outstanding Location, Small But Nice Rooms, Public Spaces Frayed Around the Edges

reviews.text: The room (upgraded) was priced right at $ 179 (with taxes etc it ended up being $ 212). Internet was in the $ 12/day range. For Boston (in this hotel class) the rate was a real bargain- probably something to do with time of year (raw to the extreme as it gets up here a this time of year. My room was small but nice (European size) with a VERY small bathroom (standing sink, toilet and tiny shower with curtain. It makes European bathrooms look large! Other than that the room was very nice- equal to a Marriott with about the same decor and feel. I sleep with ear plugs- so it was no bother to me- but without them my second floor room was noisy- so if you have no problems with heights I would go higher.
reviews.title: great location but very small room

reviews.text: Public areas have a faded "old glory" look. Carpets (still on the edge of beautiful) are fraying and look old. Dark wood paneling in the lobby, bar and PArkers (restaurant) are scratched and worn. From a distance still beautiful in a formal 19th century manner. Breakfast and lunch at Parkers- service was great- old world- pleasant but formal.
reviews.title: A hotel with History, good location but in need of some updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bell staff and front desk were nice, helpful and friendly. Nice work and glad to see this in a Boston hotel.
reviews.title: very nice historic hotel perfect for freedom trail sightseeing

reviews.text: Health Club was great- surprisingly modern and equipped withe great equipment.
reviews.title: You can mix business with pleasure here

reviews.text: Full disclosure, this was a family trip and our room was paid for. The hotel is in a great location. It is a short walk to the Common or Garden. You can get to the River or the Waterfront in 20-30 minutes by walking. There are also shops and stores close by in the event anything is needed. With all of that said, this is not the best option for families with small kids who want to be centrally located in Boston. We were booked in to a suite. I knew from research that the hotel is an old building and that rooms were generally small. Fortunately we were able to fit in with two small kids, but there was not much room beyond the bed arrangement.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Just Not Good for Familes with Small Kids

reviews.text: The bathroom is very small. While I know that hotel bathrooms are generally small, this one was tough given the lack of space to really put out anything of need. The closet arrangement also cuts into the overall amount of space in the room. As anyone with small kids can appreciate, you need to have the ability to get things out of the way for the kids. This is close to impossible with the way the room layout is since you really can't get suitcases off the floor due to the lack of closet space. The sounds from the other rooms on the floor also carry throughout the hall easily, so you will likely hear your neighbors while trying to get the kids to sleep.
reviews.title: I will always come back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was hit and miss overall. There were times when the staff was receptive to our needs, especially in the dining area. However, more often than not the staff was either slow to respond or just unresponsive. I don't need to be waited on hand and foot, but consistency and competency are large. Checkout was a mess as charges were mixed up with the other family members, which is not the short of thing you want to be dealing with when you get small kids up early for a flight.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Very Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is probably great for those with older kids or no kids, but if you have small kids I would recommend looking at other locations since it is really hard to make this place work with young ones for a period of time.
reviews.title: Misleading 2* Standard Hotel

reviews.text: I just stayed one night at the Omni Hotel because in the first hotel I wasn't able to close the windows. With the extremelzy loud outside traffik was it impossible to sleep.
reviews.title: Perfect location, exceptional service and great value
Great Service - VERY comfy bed
reviews.text: I went to Boston for 3 days for training for my job. I was alone, and my training went until after dark, so instead of navigating Boston on my own, I decided to order room service every night - and the food was delivered really quickly by a very friendly staff person.
The bed was extremely comfortable - for being in a strange city, by myself, I slept like a baby !!
reviews.title: Comfy beds!
Great service and comfy beds!
reviews.text: I will not hesitate to recommend the Omni Parker House to all my friends.

We stayed two nights at the Parker House with our teenaged daughter during her Feb. school break in order to go see Les Miz at the Opera House. The Opera House was just a few short blocks away -- so the location was great. We also easily walked over to Newbury St. in the morning and then to Quincy Market for lunch. As everyone says the location couldn't be better. As others have said the room and the bathroom were small - but we were prepared for that. What made us most happy was the VERY comfortable mattresses, wonderful pillows, comforter, spa robes, and fluffy towels!! Back in December, we stayed at the Marriott Copley Plaza (and had paid more money than at the Parker House). At the Marriott the beds sank down so much in the middle that it was actually difficult to sleep. This time at the Parker House we had comfy beds that couldn't have been more perfect! The bathroom had a shower stall but not a tub. So if you need a tub - you had better ask for one. Everything was very clean. Clean room, heavenly beds, and great location -- we were very happy campers!
reviews.title: Best historic hotel in Boston! (and a tip for better service)

reviews.text: Loved the Omni for its central location (only hotel on Beacon Hill), uber friendly service, and the upgrade to the Mother Goose Suite we were given upon arrival. We also showed up about three hours before check-in, but the room was ready to go. Big plus.
reviews.title: Hot deal in cold weather!
Warning: All of their beds are *extremely* firm
reviews.text: When I got into my room, I laid on the bed and it was of the "extra firm" variety. I have shopped at Sealy/Beautyrest mattress warehouses and have laid on many beds... this bed would certainly qualify on the extreme end of firmness.

reviews.title: An absolute must...LOVED IT!!!
reviews.text: I called the hotel management to ask them if this was somehow a special bed and they said no, all beds are the same... even so, they showed me another room and the mattress was the same.

reviews.title: Nice evening away
reviews.text: If you don't like sleeping on an extremely firm mattress you will not sleep well at this hotel.

reviews.title: Web site does not accurately reflect the rooms
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel. Fantastic staff. Beautiful rooms. Value for money. The most gorgeous hotel we've stayed at, felt like film stars!! Excellent location.
Cannot fault this hotel at all.
reviews.title: Great Location
Time to retire this hotel
reviews.text: I attended a conference here and it's just old and tired from the lobby to the rooms. Okay they have flat screen TVs and wifi, but the design is stuck in the 1930s tiny bathrooms, thin walls and uninspiring views. The beds are one of the few highlights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Omni Parker House Hotel in Boston, MA. It is located in the middle of everything Boston. The room and service was excellent and we will make sure we stay there again when in Boston. I have stayed at other hotels in Boston but this one topped them all!
reviews.title: The Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: nice hotel overall, but the basic room we had was SMALL. We stayed at the Omni in San Francisco and had a much larger room for a "basic". Also there was a "maize" to walk from the elevator to the room.
reviews.title: big hotel, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were very pleased with the location, staff was nice, huge lobby, lots of attractions very close by.
reviews.title: Thanks for room 303

reviews.text: I arrived in Boston and had booked in to this hotel via Virgin. I googled the hotel to find out what was said about it and was shocked to see that we had been allocated room 303 which is pro-ported to be haunted and not available for guests. I didn't sleep that we'll but not because of any activities of the paranormal nature, it was due to the heat in the room and the noisiness of the AC. The bed was not that comfortable either. The rest of the room was fine and the staff were very polite as you would expect.
reviews.title: nice location and very good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights at the Omni and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had never been to Boston before, they helped us map out things to see, places to eat, etc. The room was small, but nicely appointed. Our only complaint was that there was only one chair in the room. We would definitely stay again if in the area. Location was great, we could walk everywhere.
reviews.title: Wonderful accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here the night of our wedding, my wife stayed for the night before as well. The location is great, right in dowtown Boston, close to the commons and Faneuil Hall. The property itself is very nice, clean, elegant looking. Rooms are very clean and comfortable as well. Our only issue was the service. They were all very friendly, but I guess very slow would describe the service. Check-in is at 4pm, and when my wife went to check in at 4pm on a Friday, the room wasn't ready. They had to finish cleaning the room before she would be allowed in it, and that took maybe another 45 minutes or so. Then the night of the wedding, we gave them a bottle of champagne to chill and bring to the room at midnght. Around 12:30am the maid of honor stopped by the room to grab something and noticed the champagne wasn't there. So she called and asked for it to be delivered again. Then when we got to the room maybe after 1am, the champagne still wasn't there and we had to call again ourselves, and it was finally brought up. So a couple lapses in service prevented us from rating this hotel any higher.
reviews.title: Nice property; shaky service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We LOVED the location- even better than what we expected. Great service, beautiful lobby and area, wonderful history (included in the Boston walking tours even!), SMALL rooms, but that's to be expected. Clean, comfy beds, etc. Great concierge, and the desk kept our bags for us when we arrived super early in the day! We loved it.
reviews.title: GREAT location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip Advisor Notes
reviews.title: A bit disappointing

reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 3 night stay in September and we are a little disappointed with the hotel. The location is pretty good with many points of interest just a short walk away, the entrance hall and ground floor amenities look very grand. However as soon as you step into the lift you notice how worn and tired things look, our room is on the 12th floor and it is the smallest room we have ever stayed in the US.  The bathroom is so small we have to repack our wash things each time we use them as there is no space to leave anything out. I am sure they have better rooms but as we are paying $263 a night I expected more.
reviews.title: great location, nice people

reviews.text: The hotel is fine enough and is in a more lively area within the financial district. The hotel however is showing it's age in both the common areas as well as inside the hotel rooms. The rooms are fairly small but do have an old world character about them. The service was pretty good and the gym was better than what they normally have a hotel. Also there are several bars onsite that I did not have a chance to go to but looked really classy.
reviews.title: Older Hotel

reviews.text: A real quality hotel which feels very grand. Not for you if you're after a boutique feel but is very special none the less. Has the feel of the Waldorf about it but smaller and less hectic. Staff are excellent and our room was cracking and, if you want to be in the heart of Boston it won't be any better than here!
reviews.title: A grand hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights and loved the hotel and Boston. The room was very comfortable and hotel full of old world charm. Service was excellent also. The only complaint would be that the walls were a little thin we had an adjoining door in our room ( which we weren't using) so I don't know if that made a difference with the bit of noise from our neighbours. Also no free internet. Everything else was great.
reviews.title: Great location
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: This hotel was in an excellent location on freedom trail. Very old historic hotel. The only drawback is the tiny bathrooms. Make sure you also know the Internet is 10.00-it was in very small caption before you put password in.

We love staying at the Omni Parker House! A bit of a splurge for us, but it' more than worth it! The location couldn't be better to explore historic Boston, to walk to Quincy market and take in the entertainment, food and people, to enjoy Boston Commons, walk to Chinatown (be sure to have a dim sum brunch!), walk to see the Blue Man Group/theater district, etc. ! We took a taxi to the science museum, but realized walking back was so close and easy (okay, we're Vermonters!) The concierge directed us to great meals in the North End and elsewhere, and gave us easy walking directions to get there. Our room each visit was lovely and clean, sleep comfortable and peaceful, and staff super accommodating! we've discovered every trip something wonderful beyond our scope via the concierge - use the resource!
reviews.title: Our Favorite in Boston!
Great Place
reviews.text: Hotel is ideally situated in downtown Boston, just across from the beautiful park the Boston Common. Went for a walk in the Boston Common every morning and then back to the hotel for a shower. Located close to Beacon Hill and the Financial District, it has been and still is a hub for Politics and Business people alike, but amid all of this action, the hotel has plenty of time for ordinary tourist travellers like us. Staff very friendly and all modern amenities despite the fact that the Hotel is a very old building, but has held on to its tremendous character in its architecture.

reviews.title: Very Loud
reviews.text: Bedroom was a bit confined but we were only sleeping there and it was fine for us. Loads of relaxed restaurants in the Quincy Market close by and more food outlets in parts of financial area, but much is fast food there where people always seem to be in a rush. Food in eth Hotel is quite expensive. Lovely bars in different parts of eth hotel and large lobby area with tables for meeting people. Would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to be in downtown Boston.
Beware, this hotel is under construction and also has construction going on around it. Be prepared to hear loud construction noises.as early as 6:45 AM.
reviews.title: Loved the Omni

reviews.text: When I say loud, I mean that even the soundest sleepers will have trouble. When I complained, I was told by the hotel management that I was on the "quiet" side and there was nothing they could do about the problem since it involved union work rules on a project that was not in their control.
reviews.title: Living Entombment

reviews.text: Bottom line, this is a nice hotel, but stay away until the construction is done.
reviews.title: Outstanding As Usual!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a short tour of New England. The best thing about the hotel is the location, it is just a few minutes walk from the waterfront, Boston Common etc. The location would be hard to beat. The public areas and bars are all great and we received good and friendly service throughout. Only slight drawback and the reason for not giving 5 stars was the size of the room, as noted by some other reviewers, this was really pretty small as was the bathroom. Would definitely stay here again however.
reviews.title: perfect location
No Ghosts Here
reviews.text: The rooms may be small, but the beds are wonderful and all desired amenities were available. The lobby is lovely and grand, and the service from every staff member we encountered was excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Priceline got us in for a very low rate, and our breakfast in the famous restaurant was expensive but nice. The Boston Creme Pie has undergone some changes, but was still delicious and served at breakfast, a very civilized option!
reviews.title: Living in the past

reviews.text: We would stay there again and found the central location perfect for a busy day of visiting many areas of the city.
reviews.title: America's Best Hotel

reviews.text: Reading the reviews of others I was very glad to have upgraded to a De Luxe room since this was still not exactly huge. The hotel seems a bit sad, living on a glorious past history. Although our room clearly had been refurbished it had only been half done. Yes there was new wall paper in the bathroom but the tiles were as cracked and old as they had been in the 70s. The bed was incredibly comfortable but for such an old hotel, the walls were remarkably thin. I was woken by the sound of the man next door snoring... hmm, nice. The housekeeping left much to be desired. We arrived to discover a filthy duster had been left behind. The coffee pot (lovely idea) was left uncleaned and we found used tissues on the floor. It took three days of mentioning such problems before things changed - or was is that the cleaner changed that day? Was greatly disappointed and would not recommend the Omni nor will be returning. A great shame.
reviews.title: Fantastic and ghostly....

reviews.text: Landmark hotel, fabulous location, classy lobby, polite gracious staff. Rooms were fine, beds a little high but overall perfectly ok. But the walls are really thin. We had neighbors who came in very late, well after we were asleep and were having a normal conversation, and we woke right up and stayed awake until they went to sleep. It's a shame, it was a big glitch in an otherwise pleasant stay. Of course if you've go nobody next door to you you're fine, but do you want to that chance? You're going to walk all day, you need to rest at night.
reviews.title: Those Darn Thin Walls!

reviews.text: Great hotel if you are a fan of the old time look and feel. Lobby looks like you are stepping into another era.
reviews.title: Lots of Charm and Character

reviews.text: Regular rooms can be VERY small. This time we stayed in a suite and brought the baby and it was a nice size and setup, although the bathroom is still pretty tight.
reviews.title: Good for budget business

reviews.text: I prefer this part of town as it is closer to historical sights and looks like what I picture when I think of Boston. For some, it might be a little quiet on the weekend.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, but thin walls and small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking, lot all places in Boston, is a fortune. Wired access for a fee only, no wireless.
reviews.title: Great Stay At The Parker House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni Parker house for 3 nights in January - it was the best hotel out of all the hotels on our honeymoon. They gave us an upgrade to a suite with the higest bed I have ever seen, couches, large TV, free internet and free drinks and newspaper in the morning (simply because we had signed up to the select guest programme which is free).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, huge bed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was our honeymoon they also sent up two bosotn cream pies and a card to our room which was a very warming touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but with some draw backs

likes.disliked: — Noise between rooms and with heating system

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely and grand, all the staff are excellent and very helpful, and we really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, warm and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downsides were that the bathroom was quite small, and the bath was a bit marked, and as other reviews have said, the walls are very thin so take earplugs with you.
reviews.title: Magnificent Hotel & Exemplary Service

likes.liked: — Opulent and traditional style but comforts in room for the 21st century

reviews.text: I would definitely reccommend this hotel and would stay again!
reviews.title: I had a great stay at the Omni Parker House

likes.disliked: — The shower was not functioning properly

reviews.text: We spent 1 night at the historic Parker House Hotel. Lots of positives:
reviews.title: Nice Historic Hotel, thin walls!
good hotel
reviews.text: - Good service

reviews.title: 4 stars all the way
reviews.text: - Clean, but small rooms. Bathroom is very small.
- Great location, near all the main sites.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel (but not perfect)
Great place, great hotel.
reviews.text: - Staff was very helpful at the main desk, concierge and bell hops.

When reading other reviews of this hotel I kept seeing the theme of small rooms/bathrooms but we booked an "Executive room" for $129 a night and had plenty of room to spread out with a 13 year old and 10 year old. Only con was that we were on the second floor and had no view (unless you consider looking into someone's work office across the alley a view). Separate living area with couch (sleeper) and two chairs and two double beds. Bathroom was small but there was a separate dressing table and area so there wasn't a need for doubling up in the bathroom. Furnishings in the room and the bathroom were in great shape. No issues with noise that others noted. Definitely sign up for free loyalty program before you go for free wi-fi, free paper, free hot and cold beverages delivered to room each day, and other goodies. No downsides to that! Patrick at the front desk gave my 10 year old a free backpack of goodies at check in and cookies and milk first night which he really appreciated. Old world charm and kid friendly kept both the adults and kids happy. Work out room was very large with nice equipment. Location is a BIG plus.....easy walking distance to most neighborhoods, right on the Freedom trail, and all the T lines run within a block of the hotel. We had no issues taking our luggage via the Blue T line to/from airport. Food and bar options EVERYWHERE. Front desk helpful when asking if they could print an email for us. Peeked at rooftop ballroom and staff there were gracious as well. Fire alarm going off one morning made for an interesting story for the kids to tell their friends....glad we were on the second floor then!
reviews.title: Excellent choice- even with kids

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while in Boston for a conference. Although the conference was in a different hotel, I chose the Omni because of its lower rate. I enjoyed my stay there a lot. The hotel has character and it is very conveniently located near two T stations, stores, restaurants and attractions. The hotel staff were super-friendly. My room was on the smaller side (petite single) but clean and comfortable. I appreciated the printing my boarding passes for free. Overall it was a very pleasant experience. However it did seem like the management needs to pay more attention to maintaining the condition of the building. The hotel is old and some walls and ceilings -including the one in my room- looked worn out.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Omni Parker House is an historic hotel in a perfect location in Boston. Right on the Freedom Trail, one block from the Boston Commons and Park Street T-station, walking distance from three major tourist areas in three directions: to Quincy Market and the Waterfront, to the shopping and Theater District, and up Beacon Hill on the other side of the Commons.
reviews.title: Classic Old School Hotel in Excellent Location

reviews.text: Old school elegance in the lobby, restaurant (famous for inventing Boston Cream Pie) and Last Hurrah bar (all clubby with leather sofas and brass lamps, and windows looking out on the street, with reasonable prices on nice beer selection and excellent Scotch selection).
reviews.title: A comfortable, conveniently located hotel, with helpful staff

reviews.text: Rooms are somewhat old fashioned and/but very comfortable. Suite or executive room excellent deal for comfort and space to spread out. Bathroom somewhat small and older, but with nice towels and toiletries.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC HOTEL !!!

reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel for a weekly conference. This hotel is located on a few minutes walk from Boston Common and the subway. The hotel is very old and has not been renovated. The helpful staff compensated for any old eyesores. The rooms were very small and cozy. Expect to high jump into the bed as the bed height is higher than normal.
reviews.title: Old charm, great staff!

reviews.text: The conference rooms were adequate and the gym is very small. However; the fresh towels, fruit, and water helps you overlook the space.
reviews.title: A classic Stay!
Another excelent stay at this centrally located hotel
reviews.text: Great Location- Staff was amazing and very helpful! Loved the atmosphere and the rooms were very clean and welcoming! A classic place to stay, with tons of great history!

Have recently returned from a four night (which turned into five nights because of snowstorm) stay at the Boston Omni. I've stayed at the property several times before and knew that it was centrally located, within walking distance of all the city's attraction. The main purpose of my stay in Boston was to see a couple of hockey and basketball games - easy walk from from hotel to TD Banknorth Garden.
reviews.title: Historic, welcoming hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkin was its usual breeze. Swift attention by friendly staff. My room was ready at 2pm upon my arrival, and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Grand old hotel with an old fashioned and busy lobby. The room was extremely small but well-appointed and had comfortable beds. The bathroom was a decent size but sported a dorm room style shower stall that would have made a heavier person claustrophobic. That being said, the service was friendly and the maid service quick and efficient. This is a great location for the Boston Common-Fanueil Hall-North End side of town (though I prefer Copley Sq when I stay in Boston). And the walls are thick so it was quiet unlike its newer neighbor Nine Zero. If you want sleek and new don't stay here...it's charming but old.
reviews.title: Small Rooms, Good Service
Tiny room but a lovely hotel
reviews.text: My husband, 8-year-old son and I stayed at the Omni during a sightseeing trip to Boston in August 2005. Our room was well appointed, but very, very small. The bathroom was also nice and a more comfortable size. We found the staff, the concierge especially, to be very friendly and helpful. The sushi restaurant down the street was great, and perfect after a long day of walking around town. The location is within walking distance of many of the tourist attractions around Boston.

reviews.title: Great Location, Would Stay Again
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in a Queen Suite at the Omni Feb 3-5. The corner room was comfortable and spacious. We paid 159.00 a night and loved the hotel. The service was incredible, the staff was tripping over themselves to help us. We walked everywhere.
If you go to Boston with a date a nice place is the resturant on the 52nd floor of the Prudential Hall. It's a cool jazz spot with a view and great martini's.
reviews.title: Nice old classic hotel- rooms a little small
Appaling, desperate, overated, take your pick!!!
reviews.text: If you like classic hotels with history & character, this is an excellent choice. I've stayed there twice. The service is very good, the fitness center is excellent, the bar is just fabulous and the location is good. The downside: the rooms are very small. If you're not ready for this, you'll be disappointed. The "standard" rooms are miniscule, the " deluxe" rooms are actually quite tiny, too. I once stayed in a terrific executive room, there, though. I'm giving the hotel overall an excellent rating, because I just really like old hotels, and I would go back to the Parker House anytime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on our trip to Boston in March. Everything was great (with the exception of too soft of beds). This is truly a 4 star hotel, and you are in walking distance to everything. My wife and I are always budget travelers; we purchased this plus airfare for 4 days from Dallas for under $1000 (which is a deal) through Priceline. We did upgrade our bed arrangement from a full to two full which cost a little extra but was well worth it (we knew about this before we left). Another nice thing they did was get us a room with a great view (I called in a couple of days early to do this). The Parker House is the home of Boston Crème Pie and Parker House Rolls, both are great.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, with a great location!

reviews.text: Getting there:
reviews.title: Wonderful service, beautiful, historic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to take a free bus to the Subway terminal for the Blue line. After we purchased a 7day link pass ($15 each) we took the Blue line to government center (this is inbound), then it was just about two block away.
reviews.title: Expensive Parking at the Parker House

reviews.text: Hints for Boston:
reviews.title: The Omni Parker House is the best place to stay in Boston

reviews.text: Bring a compass (it is easy to get turned around).
reviews.title: Beautiful decor, great location, friendly, polite staff, readily available amenities.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni for 4 days in Sept. We booked through United Travel and requested two beds. 2 days before leaving, I called the hotel directly to be sure that we would be given two beds and was told that we would. Upon arriving, the front desk informed me that we would be given one bed and they would be able to change us after one night. The next day I was told that they wouldn't want to "inconvenience" any of their customers who would be checking in by changing their reservations. I slept on a lumpy cot one foot off the floor for the stay.
reviews.title: Great location, Terrible service

likes.disliked: — service was terrible, cold indifference from staff

reviews.text: Since we had joined their "preferred customer club" I assumed that the perks promised by the membership would be given. I was wrong. I was told that because we got the room through a "special rate" ($250 nightly), we would not receive the perks.
reviews.title: Loved the Omni Parker Boston

reviews.text: This hotel is in a wonderful location and I wouldn't expect such an old building to have large rooms but I would expect better and more considerate service. It appears that they don't appreciate travelers who book through other services rather than directly through the hotel. Don't even bother to join the membership club.
reviews.title: Great location and atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, small but beautifully furnished rooms with fresh linen. Great breakfast. In all a good hotel with interesting history. The dining facilities are great!
reviews.title: Priceline Bidders Beware

likes.disliked: — Size of the room, noisy airconditioner

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights towards the end of August. There were four of us including 2 teenagers so we went for 2 junior suites to get a bit of space. Very pleased with the rooms and overall service from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was excellent values (by the standards of English hotels). The outside of the hotel is being refurbished, but we did not notice any noise. There was a small amount of noise from the building site behind the hotel which our rooms overlooked. We chose the location to be central and close to Boston common and the T. We were very pleased with our choice. Overall a very good stay.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — step to street level, indifferent service

reviews.text: This is your grandfather's hotel for sure. If you like a good history lesson and authentic Bostonian flavour (inventors of the Boston Cream Pie!), then go crazy, this is for you. But I'm a modernist and there's just too much yellow, beige and brass for me. And for $499 i got a TINY, no view room tucked at the end of a maze of dingy hallway.
reviews.title: Yellowing with Age

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good for tourists and your parents (location is right off boston commons and sites of old, important bloody scuffles). Its a decent business hotel, at least they have coffee in the room.
reviews.title: A Little Disappointed
Family vacation
reviews.text: Do they not have hotel spas in this town?? Boston has not been good to me on this trip...

My husband and I were very excited about staying at a historic hotel in the heart of Boston; however, upon arrival we were immediately disappointed. The beautiful exterior of the hotel was covered due to renovations. We were not told about the renovations prior to booking and construction noises could be heard in our room. For the price we paid per night, I expected much more in terms of size of room and staff service. Our room was extremely small!!! The room was also awkwardly arranged-there was no desk or table, the television set was in a place that made it difficult to view, and the bathroom was very small and hard to move around in. The staff was polite, but they did not go out of their way to help us. In fact, we had to call the front desk twice to get assistance with our internet service. The location of this hotel is wonderful, but I would have traded location for a bigger room at any point on the trip!
reviews.title: This Hotel Needs More Than An Exterior Renovation~It Needs LOVE

likes.liked: — The walkable proximity to nearly everything; the bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to boston for a family vacation with our daughter and her two children. We needed adjoining rooms because our grand-daughter is a child with special needs. They could not guarantee that so they gave us a suite.
reviews.title: Take Some Earplugs!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we chose the Omni Parker because of the history and its location....we didn't know how nice it would be...we ended up really using the hotel (fitness center, restaurant and bar) and discovered what a true gem it was....if you want to walk boston, this is the place for you.
reviews.title: Central location with history

likes.liked: — The location was the most important feature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting Boston for vacation and found the Omni Parker House on Orbitz for a great price. It turned out to be in the perfect location b/c it's within walking distance to all major historical sites, and close to a 'T' stop for a quick trip to Fenway. We loved the location, but we also loved the room. It was good sized for a city hotel. The bed was very comfortable, the room was clean and the shower had water pressure! The staff was friendly and helpful, and the lobby was absolutely beautiful - the woodwork was amazing. Room service was just OK. Internet was expensive especially considering it was a slow connection.
reviews.title: You can feel the history all around you!

reviews.text: I booked into the Omni after having walked past a number of times on a previous trip. I always thought that it looked so elegant and I wasn't disappointed. The whole hotel has a warm welcoming feel which makes you forget that you are in the centre of a bustling city.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The location is the main draw of the hotel. For those who love shopping (like me!) it is about two minutes away from the shops of Downtown Crossing and Quincy Market. For the sightseers, the hotel is literally on the Freedom Trail and has honorable mentions in many guidebooks because of it's history.
reviews.title: Worst hotel stay ever

reviews.text: I was booked into a Deluxe room and it was very comfortable. There was more than enough room, the bed was HUGE and the bathroom about the size of my flat! Everything was clean and well kept. I have seen into an Economy room and I would say it is worth upgrading if you can afford it.
reviews.title: Great Historical Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Omni Parker House just place us in a relax ambiance after our stay in N.Y.
reviews.title: Boston in style

reviews.text: Luxure, attention service, good restaurant in the hôtel and near by.
reviews.title: Good location poor housekeeping.

reviews.text: Just on the other side of the street, you'll find the best steak house on the East side of Norh America. No, I'm not joking, go and try RUTH'S CHRIS STEAK HOUSE. It worth the detour.
reviews.title: Perfect for a health concious business traveler

reviews.text: I made a reservation using my iPhone unfortunately my arrival date was for the next day. Front desk was able to accommodate me no problem. The room was small, bathroom tiny. The rug in the room was frayed. Went to the Celts game after the game went to retire for the night and pulled down the comforter. The bright white sheet was loaded with hairs. Sceeved out bug time. Upon further examinatiion it doesn't look like the matress sheet was even changed. Very disappointed I almost exclusively only stay in Omni Hotels for the reward benefits. Unlikely to return here really grossed out.
reviews.title: The most awesome family suite ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was shocked that this was the most affordable available in my company's booking system. I signed up for the rewards, had a "get fit kit" in my room (includes a yoga mat, wrist weights, and a resistance band). So assumed since they had that benefit, their gym would suck. Not so! They had tons of machines with individual tvs on the cardio stuff, was open 24 hours, and had a giant bowl of apples and oranges available for free every morning. My rewards also got me a free wake-up beverage of my choice at a time specifically listed by me. Everyone was incredibly nice, and my room was great as well. Just couldn't believe how well an old classic hotel catered to those trying to stay fit while traveling, not typical.
reviews.title: When can I come back.....

description: Located along the historic Freedom Trail in the heart of downtown Boston, the Omni Parker House has the perfect location from which to experience Boston.
